metadata.name: AS9100D_Complete_Audit_System_With_Guide
metadata.title: Comprehensive AS9100D Internal Audit Management System
metadata.description: Complete auditing tool covering all AS9100D requirements including aerospace-specific clauses, audit workflow, findings management, corrective actions, risk-based thinking, configuration management, and continuous improvement tracking

nodes.name: AS9100D Standard
nodes.description: AS9100D - Quality Management Systems - Requirements for Aviation, Space and Defense Organizations

nodes.name: Clause 4: Context of Organization
nodes.description: Understanding organization and its context, needs and expectations of interested parties, QMS scope, and QMS processes

nodes.name: 4.1 Understanding Organization Context
nodes.description: Determine external and internal issues relevant to purpose and strategic direction that affect QMS
nodes.auditQuestions: How does organization identify internal/external issues? How are these monitored and reviewed?
nodes.evidenceRequired: SWOT analysis, strategic planning documents, business environment review

nodes.name: 4.2 Interested Parties
nodes.description: Determine interested parties relevant to QMS and their requirements
nodes.auditQuestions: Who are identified interested parties? How are their requirements determined and monitored?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Stakeholder register, customer requirements matrix, regulatory requirements list

nodes.name: 4.3 QMS Scope
nodes.description: Determine boundaries and applicability of QMS to establish its scope
nodes.auditQuestions: What is QMS scope? Are exclusions justified? Does scope cover all products/services/sites?
nodes.evidenceRequired: QMS scope statement, exclusions justification, site certifications

nodes.name: 4.4 QMS and Its Processes
nodes.description: Establish, implement, maintain and continually improve QMS including needed processes and their interactions
nodes.auditQuestions: Are all processes identified? Are process interactions defined? Are processes achieving intended results?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Process map, turtle diagrams, process performance data, SIPOC diagrams

nodes.name: Clause 5: Leadership
nodes.description: Leadership and commitment, policy, organizational roles, responsibilities and authorities

nodes.name: 5.1 Leadership & Commitment
nodes.description: Top management demonstrates leadership and commitment to QMS and customer focus
nodes.auditQuestions: How does top management demonstrate QMS commitment? Are resources provided? Is customer focus promoted?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Management meeting minutes, resource allocation records, management review evidence

nodes.name: 5.2 Quality Policy
nodes.description: Establish, implement and maintain quality policy appropriate to purpose and context
nodes.auditQuestions: Is quality policy appropriate? Is it communicated? Is it reviewed? Does it support strategic direction?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Quality policy document, communication records, review meeting minutes

nodes.name: 5.3 Roles, Responsibilities & Authorities
nodes.description: Assign responsibilities and authorities for relevant roles and ensure they are communicated and understood
nodes.auditQuestions: Are roles/responsibilities defined? Are authorities clear? Do people understand their roles?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Organization charts, job descriptions, delegation of authority matrix

nodes.name: Clause 6: Planning
nodes.description: Actions to address risks and opportunities, quality objectives and planning to achieve them, planning of changes

nodes.name: 6.1 Risk & Opportunities
nodes.description: Determine risks and opportunities that need to be addressed to ensure QMS achieves intended results
nodes.auditQuestions: How are risks identified? Are opportunities identified? Are actions planned and implemented? Is effectiveness evaluated?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Risk register, FMEA, opportunity analysis, action plans, effectiveness reviews

nodes.name: 6.2 Quality Objectives
nodes.description: Establish quality objectives at relevant functions and levels and planning to achieve them
nodes.auditQuestions: Are objectives measurable? Are they consistent with policy? Are they monitored? Who is responsible?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Objectives list, measurement plans, progress tracking, responsibility assignments

nodes.name: 6.3 Planning of Changes
nodes.description: When changes to QMS are needed, carry out in a planned manner considering purpose and potential consequences
nodes.auditQuestions: How are QMS changes planned? Are consequences considered? Are resources available? Are responsibilities clear?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Change management procedures, change requests, impact assessments, implementation plans

nodes.name: Clause 7: Support
nodes.description: Resources, competence, awareness, communication, documented information

nodes.name: 7.1 Resources
nodes.description: Determine and provide resources needed for establishment, implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of QMS
nodes.auditQuestions: Are adequate resources provided? Are infrastructure needs addressed? Is work environment suitable?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Resource planning, budget allocations, equipment lists, facility assessments

nodes.name: 7.1.4 Work Environment - FOD Prevention
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Foreign Object Debris (FOD) prevention program to minimize risk of FOD in products and work environment
nodes.auditQuestions: Is FOD prevention program established? Are FOD controls implemented? Is FOD awareness trained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: FOD prevention procedures, FOD walks records, tool control, training records

nodes.name: 7.1.5 Monitoring & Measuring Resources
nodes.description: Ensure resources for monitoring and measuring are suitable, maintained, and calibrated/verified
nodes.auditQuestions: Are measurement devices identified? Is calibration controlled? Are records maintained? Is traceability ensured?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Calibration certificates, equipment list, measurement system analysis, calibration procedures

nodes.name: 7.2 Competence
nodes.description: Determine necessary competence, ensure competence, take actions to acquire competence, evaluate effectiveness
nodes.auditQuestions: How is competence determined? Is training provided? Is effectiveness evaluated? Are records maintained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Competency matrix, training records, qualification records, effectiveness evaluations

nodes.name: 7.3 Awareness
nodes.description: Ensure persons are aware of quality policy, relevant objectives, their contribution, and implications of nonconformity
nodes.auditQuestions: Are employees aware of policy? Do they understand their role? Are they aware of product safety implications?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Training records, awareness surveys, meeting minutes, communication records

nodes.name: 7.4 Communication
nodes.description: Determine internal and external communications relevant to QMS including what, when, with whom, how, and who
nodes.auditQuestions: Is communication process defined? Are internal/external communications effective? Are records maintained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Communication plan, meeting records, bulletins, email communications, change notifications

nodes.name: 7.5 Documented Information
nodes.description: Control of documented information required by QMS and needed for effectiveness including creation, update, and control
nodes.auditQuestions: Is document control effective? Are documents identified? Are obsolete documents prevented? Is access controlled?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Document control procedure, document register, revision history, approval records

nodes.name: Clause 8: Operation
nodes.description: Operational planning and control, product requirements, design, external providers, production, product release, nonconforming output

nodes.name: 8.1 Operational Planning & Control
nodes.description: Plan, implement and control processes needed to meet product/service provision requirements
nodes.auditQuestions: Is production planned? Are process requirements determined? Are criteria established? Are resources controlled?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Production plans, work orders, process flow charts, resource allocation

nodes.name: 8.1.1 Operational Risk Management
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Risk management throughout product realization for meeting product requirements and customer satisfaction
nodes.auditQuestions: Is operational risk managed? Are process FMEAs performed? Are risks mitigated? Is risk review ongoing?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Process FMEA, risk assessments, mitigation plans, risk review records

nodes.name: 8.1.2 Configuration Management
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Configuration management process to control product configuration throughout product lifecycle
nodes.auditQuestions: Is configuration controlled? Are changes managed? Is configuration status tracked? Are baselines established?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Configuration management plan, baseline documentation, change control records, CM audits

nodes.name: 8.1.3 Product Safety
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Identify and control product safety related items including critical items and key characteristics
nodes.auditQuestions: Are critical items identified? Are key characteristics controlled? Are special processes verified? Is traceability maintained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Critical items list, key characteristics, special process controls, traceability records

nodes.name: 8.1.4 Prevention of Counterfeit Parts
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Process to prevent use of suspected unapproved or counterfeit parts and materials
nodes.auditQuestions: Are counterfeit parts prevented? Is supplier approval verified? Are inspection methods defined? Is traceability maintained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Counterfeit prevention procedure, approved supplier list, inspection records, traceability

nodes.name: 8.2 Product & Service Requirements
nodes.description: Communication with customers, determining product requirements, review of requirements, changes to requirements
nodes.auditQuestions: Are customer requirements determined? Is contract review performed? Are changes controlled? Is communication effective?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Customer orders, contract review records, requirement changes, customer communications

nodes.name: 8.3 Design & Development
nodes.description: Design planning, inputs, controls, outputs, changes - full design control process for product development
nodes.auditQuestions: Is design planned? Are inputs/outputs controlled? Are design reviews conducted? Are changes managed? Is validation performed?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Design plans, design inputs/outputs, review records, verification/validation records, change records

nodes.name: 8.4 External Providers Control
nodes.description: Control of externally provided processes, products and services including supplier selection, monitoring and re-evaluation
nodes.auditQuestions: Are suppliers approved? Is supplier performance monitored? Are purchase orders adequate? Is supplier quality controlled?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Approved supplier list, supplier evaluations, purchase orders, supplier quality records

nodes.name: 8.5 Production & Service Provision
nodes.description: Control of production and service provision including identification, traceability, property control, preservation, post-delivery
nodes.auditQuestions: Is production controlled? Is traceability maintained? Are special processes validated? Is product preserved?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Work instructions, production records, traceability records, validation records, preservation records

nodes.name: 8.5.1 Control of Production
nodes.description: Implement production under controlled conditions with documented information, monitoring, competent persons, validation
nodes.auditQuestions: Are work instructions available? Is monitoring performed? Are operators competent? Are processes validated?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Work instructions, monitoring records, training records, process validation

nodes.name: 8.5.2 Identification & Traceability
nodes.description: Use suitable means to identify outputs and maintain identification throughout production and delivery
nodes.auditQuestions: Is product identified? Is traceability maintained? Can product history be traced? Are serialization requirements met?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Product labels, traceability matrix, serial number records, material certifications

nodes.name: 8.5.3 Customer Property
nodes.description: Exercise care with customer property while under organization's control including identification, verification, protection
nodes.auditQuestions: Is customer property identified? Is it protected? Are issues reported? Are records maintained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Customer property register, inspection records, storage records, damage reports

nodes.name: 8.5.4 Preservation
nodes.description: Preserve outputs during production and service provision including identification, handling, packaging, storage, protection
nodes.auditQuestions: Is product preserved? Are handling methods appropriate? Is packaging adequate? Are storage conditions suitable?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Handling procedures, packaging specifications, storage area inspections, preservation records

nodes.name: 8.5.5 Post-Delivery Activities
nodes.description: Meet requirements for post-delivery activities including warranty, maintenance, recycling, disposal considerations
nodes.auditQuestions: Are post-delivery activities defined? Is warranty support provided? Are customer issues addressed?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Post-delivery service procedures, warranty records, customer support records

nodes.name: 8.5.6 Control of Changes
nodes.description: Review and control changes for production or service provision to ensure continued conformity with requirements
nodes.auditQuestions: Are production changes controlled? Is review documented? Are changes verified? Are effects assessed?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Change requests, change approvals, impact assessments, verification records

nodes.name: 8.6 Release of Products & Services
nodes.description: Implement planned arrangements to verify product requirements are met before release including inspection and acceptance
nodes.auditQuestions: Are products inspected before release? Is acceptance criteria met? Are release approvals documented? Is traceability maintained?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Inspection records, test results, acceptance documentation, release approvals, certificates of conformance

nodes.name: 8.7 Nonconforming Output Control
nodes.description: Ensure nonconforming output is identified and controlled to prevent unintended use or delivery including disposition
nodes.auditQuestions: Is nonconforming product identified? Is it segregated? Is disposition appropriate? Are concessions controlled? Are actions taken?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Nonconformance reports, segregation areas, disposition records, concession approvals, corrective actions

nodes.name: Clause 9: Performance Evaluation
nodes.description: Monitoring, measurement, analysis, evaluation, internal audit, management review

nodes.name: 9.1 Monitoring, Measurement, Analysis & Evaluation
nodes.description: Determine what needs to be monitored and measured, methods, when to analyze and evaluate results
nodes.auditQuestions: What is monitored? Are methods suitable? Is data analyzed? Are results evaluated? Are actions taken?
nodes.evidenceRequired: KPI dashboard, metrics data, analysis reports, trend analysis, action plans

nodes.name: 9.1.2 Customer Satisfaction
nodes.description: Monitor customer perceptions of degree to which needs and expectations have been fulfilled
nodes.auditQuestions: How is satisfaction measured? Are surveys conducted? Are complaints tracked? Is feedback acted upon?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Customer surveys, complaint logs, on-time delivery metrics, customer feedback, scorecards

nodes.name: 9.1.3 Analysis & Evaluation
nodes.description: Analyze and evaluate appropriate data and information arising from monitoring and measurement
nodes.auditQuestions: Is data analyzed? Are trends identified? Are root causes found? Are improvements identified?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Data analysis reports, trend charts, Pareto analysis, statistical analysis

nodes.name: 9.2 Internal Audit
nodes.description: Conduct internal audits at planned intervals to provide information on QMS conformity and effective implementation
nodes.auditQuestions: Is audit program established? Are audits conducted per schedule? Are auditors competent and independent? Are findings addressed?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Audit schedule, audit plans, audit reports, auditor qualifications, corrective action records

nodes.name: 9.3 Management Review
nodes.description: Top management reviews QMS at planned intervals to ensure continuing suitability, adequacy, effectiveness and alignment
nodes.auditQuestions: Are reviews conducted? Are inputs comprehensive? Are outputs documented? Are decisions implemented?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Management review agenda, meeting minutes, inputs data, outputs and action items

nodes.name: Clause 10: Improvement
nodes.description: Nonconformity and corrective action, continual improvement

nodes.name: 10.2 Nonconformity & Corrective Action
nodes.description: React to nonconformity, evaluate need for action, implement actions, review effectiveness, update risks and opportunities
nodes.auditQuestions: Are nonconformities identified? Is root cause analysis performed? Are corrective actions implemented? Is effectiveness verified?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Nonconformance reports, root cause analysis, corrective action plans, effectiveness verification

nodes.name: 10.3 Continual Improvement
nodes.description: Continually improve suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of QMS considering results of analysis and evaluation
nodes.auditQuestions: Are improvement opportunities identified? Are improvements implemented? Is effectiveness measured?
nodes.evidenceRequired: Improvement projects, kaizen events, process optimization records, results measurement

nodes.name: Annual Audit Program
nodes.description: Comprehensive annual audit program covering all QMS processes based on importance, changes, and previous results

nodes.name: Audit Planning
nodes.description: Define audit criteria, scope, frequency, methods for each audit

nodes.name: Define Audit Scope
nodes.description: Determine areas, processes, clauses, and departments to be audited

nodes.name: Auditor Selection & Assignment
nodes.description: Select qualified auditors ensuring independence and competence

nodes.name: Prepare Audit Checklists
nodes.description: Develop detailed checklists based on AS9100D clauses and process requirements

nodes.name: Document Review
nodes.description: Review relevant procedures, work instructions, previous audit reports, and open corrective actions

nodes.name: Opening Meeting
nodes.description: Conduct opening meeting with auditees to introduce team, confirm scope, and explain process

nodes.name: Evidence Collection
nodes.description: Gather objective evidence through document review, observations, interviews, and measurements

nodes.name: Document Findings
nodes.description: Document all nonconformities, observations, and positive practices with clear evidence

nodes.name: Analyze Findings
nodes.description: Review and classify findings with audit team, verify evidence, determine severity

nodes.name: Closing Meeting
nodes.description: Present findings to management and auditees, discuss nonconformities and required actions

nodes.name: Audit Report
nodes.description: Formal report documenting scope, objectives, findings, positive observations, nonconformities, and conclusions

nodes.name: Corrective Action Planning
nodes.description: Auditee develops corrective action plan with root cause analysis and preventive measures

nodes.name: Corrective Action Implementation
nodes.description: Implement corrective actions to address root causes and prevent recurrence

nodes.name: Effectiveness Verification
nodes.description: Verify effectiveness of corrective actions through evidence review and follow-up audit

nodes.name: Audit Closure
nodes.description: Close audit after all corrective actions verified effective and records archived

nodes.name: Major Nonconformity
nodes.description: Absence or total breakdown of a system to meet a requirement, or systematic failure that creates doubt about system capability

nodes.name: Minor Nonconformity
nodes.description: Isolated lapse or single observed failure that does not indicate systematic breakdown but still requires correction

nodes.name: Observation
nodes.description: Potential weakness or area for improvement that has not yet resulted in nonconformity but could if not addressed

nodes.name: Positive Practice
nodes.description: Notable good practice or strength worthy of recognition and potential sharing across organization

nodes.name: Auditor Qualification Requirements
nodes.description: Requirements for auditor competence including education, training, auditing skills, and independence
nodes.requirements: AS9100 knowledge, audit training, industry experience, interpersonal skills

nodes.name: Auditor Independence
nodes.description: Ensure auditors do not audit their own work and maintain objectivity and impartiality
nodes.requirements: No conflict of interest, objective evaluation, impartial reporting

nodes.name: Risk-Based Audit Approach
nodes.description: Focus audit resources on higher risk areas considering importance of processes, complexity, and previous audit results

nodes.name: Process Approach Auditing
nodes.description: Audit processes as systems with inputs, outputs, interactions, and measurements rather than just documents

nodes.name: Root Cause Analysis Tools
nodes.description: Tools and techniques for identifying root causes including 5 Whys, Fishbone, Fault Tree Analysis
nodes.tools: 5 Whys, Fishbone Diagram, Fault Tree, Pareto Analysis

nodes.name: Audit Program Metrics
nodes.description: Key performance indicators for audit program including completion rate, finding closure rate, audit effectiveness
nodes.kpis: Schedule adherence, findings by type, closure time, repeat findings

nodes.name: Critical Items Management
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Identification and control of critical items whose failure could result in unsafe condition

nodes.name: Key Characteristics Control
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Control of key characteristics - features that impact product safety or compliance with regulations
nodes.requirements: Identification on drawings, process controls, verification, records

nodes.name: Special Process Control
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Control of special processes (welding, heat treat, NDT, coating) where output cannot be fully verified by inspection
nodes.requirements: Qualified processes, qualified personnel, validated equipment, monitoring

nodes.name: First Article Inspection (FAI)
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Complete verification of first production article to ensure design meets specifications
nodes.requirements: AS9102 compliant, full dimensional inspection, all characteristics verified

nodes.name: NADCAP Accreditation
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Industry managed approach to special processes and products approval (if applicable to scope)
nodes.requirements: NADCAP audit, task group requirements, PRI oversight

nodes.name: Customer Source Inspection
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Customer right to witness operations and inspect products at supplier facility
nodes.requirements: Hold points, witness points, notification, access provision

nodes.name: Flow-Down of Requirements
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Ensure customer, statutory, regulatory requirements flow down to external providers
nodes.requirements: Purchase order requirements, supplier awareness, verification

nodes.name: On-Time Delivery Monitoring
nodes.description: AS9100 Specific: Monitor and report on-time delivery performance to customer requirements
nodes.kpis: OTD percentage, schedule adherence, late delivery root cause

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 4
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 4 - Context of Organization
nodes.checklistItems: Context understanding, interested parties, QMS scope, processes

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 5
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 5 - Leadership
nodes.checklistItems: Leadership commitment, quality policy, roles and responsibilities

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 6
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 6 - Planning
nodes.checklistItems: Risk and opportunities, quality objectives, planning of changes

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 7
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 7 - Support
nodes.checklistItems: Resources, competence, awareness, communication, documented info, FOD, calibration

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 8
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 8 - Operation
nodes.checklistItems: Planning, risk, config mgmt, product safety, counterfeit prevention, design, suppliers, production, release, NC

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 9
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 9 - Performance Evaluation
nodes.checklistItems: Monitoring, customer satisfaction, analysis, internal audit, management review

nodes.name: Audit Checklist: Clause 10
nodes.description: Detailed audit checklist for Clause 10 - Improvement
nodes.checklistItems: Nonconformity handling, corrective action, continual improvement

nodes.name: START HERE: Welcome to Your AS9100D Audit System
nodes.description: This is your complete AS9100D internal audit management system. It contains 107 nodes covering all AS9100D requirements, aerospace-specific controls, complete audit workflow, finding classification, and continuous improvement tracking. Follow the connected nodes to learn how to use each component.
nodes.userAction: Read this node first, then follow the 'next step' edges to learn the system

nodes.name: Step 1: Load the AS9100D Audit System
nodes.description: Open NodeBook Builder and load the AS9100D_Complete_Audit_System.json file using File ‚Üí Open. The graph will load with 107 nodes and 87 edges representing the complete AS9100D audit framework.
nodes.expectedResult: 107 nodes appear on canvas with color-coded categories
nodes.troubleshooting: If file doesn't load, verify JSON format is valid and file extension is .json

nodes.name: Step 2: Understand the Color Coding System
nodes.description: The graph uses strategic color coding: Dark Blue (#2c3e50) = AS9100D Standard; Blue (#3498db) = Clause 4; Red (#e74c3c) = Clause 5; Orange (#f39c12) = Clause 6; Purple (#9b59b6) = Clause 7 & Audit Process; Teal (#16a085) = Clause 8 Operations; Green (#27ae60) = Clause 9 Performance; Orange (#e67e22) = Clause 10 Improvement; Dark Red (#c0392b) = Critical Items; Gold (#f39c12) = Checklists. This helps you quickly identify node types.
nodes.userAction: Look at the graph and identify clusters by color
nodes.tip: Use the Filter feature (btn-filter) to show/hide specific colors or categories

nodes.name: Step 3: Explore the Graph Structure
nodes.description: The graph has a hierarchical structure: Top Center = AS9100D Standard; Left Side = Context, Leadership, Planning (Clauses 4-6); Right Side = Support, Operations (Clauses 7-8); Bottom = Performance & Improvement (Clauses 9-10); Lower Left = Audit Process Workflow; Right Side = Aerospace-Specific Requirements. Navigate by clicking nodes to see their details in the Properties Panel.
nodes.userAction: Click on different nodes to view their properties, relationships, and details
nodes.navigationTip: Use mouse wheel to zoom, click-drag to pan, spacebar+drag for faster panning

nodes.name: Understanding Node Properties
nodes.description: Each node contains rich information: NAME = Clause or process name; DESCRIPTION = Detailed explanation; CATEGORY = Main classification; SUBCATEGORY = Specific type; AUDIT QUESTIONS = What to ask during audit; EVIDENCE REQUIRED = Documents/records needed; PRIORITY = Critical/High/Medium/Low; DEADLINE = Due dates for actions; LINKS (1-4) = References to procedures, standards, forms; Custom fields like clauseNumber, auditFrequency, typicalDuration, responsiblePerson, etc.
nodes.userAction: Click any node and examine the Properties Panel on the right side

nodes.name: Understanding Edge Relationships
nodes.description: Edges show relationships between nodes: 'defines' = Standard defines requirements; 'includes' = Parent clause includes sub-clauses; 'requires' = One element requires another; 'leads to' = Sequential workflow steps; 'triggers' = Causes next action; 'uses' = Applies methodology/tool; 'audited using' = Links clauses to checklists; 'classified as' = Finding types. Follow edges to trace audit workflow, requirement hierarchies, and process dependencies.
nodes.userAction: Click on edges (lines) to see relationship descriptions
nodes.visualTip: Thicker edges (weight: 2) indicate more critical relationships

nodes.name: USE CASE 1: Planning Your Annual Audit Program
nodes.description: To plan your annual audit program: 1) Start at 'Annual Audit Program' node; 2) Review all AS9100D clause nodes to determine which processes/areas to audit; 3) Use 'Risk-Based Audit Approach' node to prioritize high-risk areas; 4) Update 'Annual Audit Program' node with your schedule and total audit days; 5) Create schedule based on auditFrequency field in each clause (Annual/Semi-Annual); 6) Consider typicalDuration field for time estimation; 7) Assign auditors ensuring independence requirements are met.
nodes.userAction: Navigate to 'Annual Audit Program' node and customize with your dates and schedule
nodes.bestPractice: Audit Clause 8 (Operations) semi-annually due to its criticality in aerospace
nodes.toolsToUse: Edit node properties, add custom deadline dates, update responsible persons

nodes.name: USE CASE 2: Conducting an Internal Audit
nodes.description: To conduct an audit: 1) Follow audit process workflow starting from 'Audit Planning' ‚Üí 'Define Audit Scope' ‚Üí 'Auditor Selection'; 2) Use clause-specific checklist nodes (e.g., 'Audit Checklist: Clause 8'); 3) During execution, refer to 'auditQuestions' and 'evidenceRequired' fields in each clause node; 4) Document findings using 'Document Findings' node as guide; 5) Classify findings (Major NC, Minor NC, Observation, Positive); 6) Follow to 'Closing Meeting' and 'Audit Report'; 7) Each step has estimatedDuration to help with scheduling.
nodes.userAction: Follow the purple audit process nodes sequentially from planning through closure
nodes.bestPractice: Use the 'auditQuestions' field in each clause as your interview guide
nodes.toolsToUse: Search function to quickly find specific clauses or requirements

nodes.name: USE CASE 3: Tracking Audit Findings
nodes.description: To track findings: 1) When findings are identified, create new nodes or update existing ones with finding details; 2) Link finding nodes to the specific clause violated; 3) Use finding type nodes to classify severity (Major/Minor/Observation); 4) Follow edges from 'Document Findings' ‚Üí 'Corrective Action Plan' ‚Üí 'CA Implementation' ‚Üí 'Effectiveness Verification'; 5) Update deadline fields with target closure dates; 6) Use priority field to manage urgent findings; 7) Add responsible person names; 8) Link to supporting documentation in link1-4 fields.
nodes.userAction: Add new nodes for specific findings and connect them to violated clauses
nodes.bestPractice: Major NC should have immediate attention with deadline = 30 days max
nodes.toolsToUse: Create new nodes (Ctrl+Click), edit properties to add finding details

nodes.name: USE CASE 4: Auditing Aerospace-Specific Requirements
nodes.description: For aerospace-specific audits: 1) Focus on nodes marked 'aerospaceSpecific: true'; 2) Critical areas: FOD Prevention (7.1.4), Configuration Management (8.1.2), Product Safety (8.1.3), Counterfeit Prevention (8.1.4), Critical Items, Key Characteristics, Special Processes, First Article Inspection, NADCAP; 3) These require enhanced controls and documentation; 4) Check for proper identification, traceability, and validation; 5) Verify flow-down to suppliers; 6) Review customer source inspection arrangements; 7) Validate on-time delivery metrics.
nodes.userAction: Filter nodes by 'AS9100 Specific' category to see all aerospace requirements
nodes.bestPractice: These are often areas of highest customer concern and regulatory focus

nodes.name: USE CASE 5: Training New Auditors
nodes.description: To train auditors: 1) Start trainees at AS9100D Standard node to understand the foundation; 2) Walk through each clause systematically (4‚Üí10); 3) Show how sub-clauses connect to parent requirements; 4) Review audit process workflow step-by-step; 5) Practice using checklist nodes during mock audits; 6) Show finding classification system; 7) Demonstrate how to trace from finding ‚Üí root cause ‚Üí corrective action ‚Üí verification; 8) Review auditor qualification and independence requirements; 9) Practice using process approach and risk-based thinking.
nodes.userAction: Use graph as interactive training material - trainees can explore connections
nodes.bestPractice: Have trainees click through audit workflow while referencing actual procedures
nodes.toolsToUse: Shortest Path tool to show connection between any two requirements

nodes.name: CUSTOMIZATION 1: Add Your Company Information
nodes.description: Customize for your organization: 1) Update metadata (name, title, description) with your company name; 2) In node properties, update link1-4 fields with paths to YOUR procedures, work instructions, forms, and templates; 3) Example: For 'Clause 7.5 Documented Information' node, replace link1 with your document control procedure path; 4) Add your document management system links; 5) Update 'responsiblePerson' fields with actual names/titles from your organization; 6) Add your specific audit schedule dates to deadline fields.
nodes.userAction: Edit each relevant node and update link1-4 fields with your document paths
nodes.bestPractice: Use consistent naming convention for links (e.g., file:///procedures/QA-001.pdf)
nodes.timeEstimate: 2-3 hours to fully customize all document links

nodes.name: CUSTOMIZATION 2: Add Your Specific Processes
nodes.description: Add company-specific processes: 1) Create new nodes for your unique processes (e.g., 'Titanium Machining Process', 'Composite Layup Process'); 2) Connect them to relevant AS9100D clause nodes; 3) Add your process-specific audit questions and evidence requirements; 4) Include your key performance indicators (KPIs); 5) Link to your process flow charts, FMEAs, control plans; 6) Add process owner information; 7) Include any customer-specific requirements or specifications.
nodes.userAction: Ctrl+Click to create new nodes, then edit properties and create edges to link them
nodes.bestPractice: Use consistent colors for your custom processes to distinguish from standard nodes
nodes.example: Create 'Welding Process' node, link to Clause 8.5 and 'Special Processes' node

nodes.name: CUSTOMIZATION 3: Build Your Findings Database
nodes.description: Create a findings tracking system: 1) Add nodes for each actual audit finding from your audits; 2) Name them with finding ID (e.g., 'Finding 2025-001: Calibration Overdue'); 3) Connect to the violated clause; 4) Include finding description, evidence, responsible person, due date; 5) Link corrective action nodes showing what was done; 6) Add effectiveness verification nodes with verification results; 7) Track status (Open/In Progress/Closed); 8) Over time, this becomes your historical findings database showing trends and repeat issues.
nodes.userAction: Create finding nodes after each audit and link them to the audit report node
nodes.bestPractice: Use red for open findings, yellow for in-progress, green for closed
nodes.powerfulFeature: Use Search to find all findings related to a specific clause or area

nodes.name: CUSTOMIZATION 4: Integrate Your Risk Register
nodes.description: Connect risk management: 1) Create nodes for your identified risks; 2) Link risks to relevant AS9100D clauses (especially 6.1 and 8.1.1); 3) Include risk rating, mitigation actions, and residual risk; 4) Show which audits address each risk; 5) Link risks to process nodes they affect; 6) Track risk-based audit decisions; 7) Show how findings relate to risks (did they occur despite mitigations?); 8) Update risk status based on audit results.
nodes.userAction: Create risk nodes and connect them to processes and audit activities
nodes.bestPractice: Use size to represent risk severity (larger = higher risk)
nodes.benefit: Visualize how audit program addresses your risk profile

nodes.name: CUSTOMIZATION 5: Add Customer-Specific Requirements
nodes.description: Include customer requirements: 1) Create nodes for customer-specific requirements (e.g., 'Boeing D6-82479', 'Airbus AIMS', 'Pratt & Whitney PW-1000'); 2) Link to relevant AS9100D clauses they supplement; 3) Add customer audit/inspection requirements; 4) Include special characteristics or critical items from customer drawings; 5) Show flow-down requirements to suppliers; 6) Add customer scorecards and metrics; 7) Link to customer portals or communication platforms; 8) Track customer visits and source inspections.
nodes.userAction: Create customer requirement nodes with specific spec numbers and requirements
nodes.bestPractice: Use a distinct color (e.g., blue) for all customer-specific nodes
nodes.compliance: Ensures customer requirements are not overlooked during audits

nodes.name: WORKFLOW: Annual Planning Process
nodes.description: Annual planning workflow: START with Management Review results ‚Üí Identify areas requiring audit focus ‚Üí Review 'Risk-Based Audit Approach' ‚Üí Update 'Annual Audit Program' node ‚Üí Allocate resources and assign auditors ‚Üí Develop audit schedule considering: process importance, changes, previous results, resource availability ‚Üí Communicate program to organization ‚Üí Get management approval ‚Üí Monitor program execution monthly ‚Üí Adjust as needed for changes. Document in program year field.
nodes.keyNodes: Annual Audit Program, Risk-Based Auditing, Management Review

nodes.name: WORKFLOW: Single Audit Execution
nodes.description: For each audit: Define Audit Scope ‚Üí Select Auditors (check independence) ‚Üí Prepare Audit Checklist ‚Üí Review Documents ‚Üí Conduct Opening Meeting ‚Üí Collect Evidence (interviews, observations, records) ‚Üí Document Findings (as they occur) ‚Üí Analyze Findings (classify severity) ‚Üí Conduct Closing Meeting (present results) ‚Üí Prepare Audit Report (within 5 days) ‚Üí Issue Report to auditee ‚Üí Track Corrective Actions ‚Üí Verify Effectiveness ‚Üí Close Audit ‚Üí Update Program Metrics. Follow the purple nodes in sequence.
nodes.keyNodes: All purple audit process nodes from Planning through Closure

nodes.name: WORKFLOW: Corrective Action Process
nodes.description: CA workflow: Finding identified ‚Üí Auditee receives report ‚Üí Determine need for CA (minor vs. major) ‚Üí Perform Root Cause Analysis (use tools node for methods) ‚Üí Develop CA Plan (address root cause, not just symptom) ‚Üí Get approval ‚Üí Implement CA ‚Üí Verify Implementation ‚Üí Wait appropriate time ‚Üí Verify Effectiveness (did it prevent recurrence?) ‚Üí Close finding OR Re-plan if ineffective ‚Üí Update risk register ‚Üí Document lessons learned. Links to Clause 10.2 requirements.
nodes.keyNodes: Corrective Action Plan, CA Implementation, Effectiveness Verification, Clause 10.2

nodes.name: WORKFLOW: Continuous Improvement Cycle
nodes.description: Improvement cycle: Audit identifies observations and positive practices ‚Üí Analyze trends across multiple audits ‚Üí Identify systemic improvement opportunities ‚Üí Review with management ‚Üí Prioritize improvements ‚Üí Implement changes ‚Üí Monitor results ‚Üí Share best practices ‚Üí Update procedures if needed ‚Üí Include in next audit scope ‚Üí Feed into Management Review ‚Üí Restart cycle. This links Clause 9 (Performance Evaluation) to Clause 10 (Improvement).
nodes.keyNodes: Continual Improvement, Management Review, Analysis & Evaluation

nodes.name: BEST PRACTICE 1: Thorough Preparation
nodes.description: Before each audit: Review previous audit reports and open findings; Study process flow and procedures; Understand process risks (from node 8.1.1); Review customer complaints related to area; Check recent quality metrics/KPIs; Review any recent changes to process; Prepare specific questions based on context; Have checklists ready but don't be bound by them; Understand the 'why' not just the 'what'; Plan adequate time - don't rush critical areas.
nodes.benefit: Better quality audits with more meaningful findings
nodes.impact: Reduces audit time while increasing effectiveness

nodes.name: BEST PRACTICE 2: Objective Evidence
nodes.description: Always base findings on objective evidence: Don't rely on 'he said / she said'; Take photos of physical evidence; Request actual records, not just procedures; Verify by observation when possible (see it happening); Sample multiple instances, not just one; Get serial numbers, dates, names for traceability; Use the 'evidenceRequired' field in each clause node as your guide; Document evidence clearly in finding reports; Keep audit trail for findings.

nodes.name: BEST PRACTICE 3: Use Process Approach
nodes.description: Audit processes, not just documents: Follow the flow from input ‚Üí process ‚Üí output; Talk to people doing the work, not just managers; Verify process interactions (how outputs feed next process); Check process effectiveness (achieving intended results?); Use turtle diagram thinking (Who? What? How? Measures?); Reference the 'Process Approach Auditing' node; Understand process context and constraints; Look at process performance data; Verify process risks are managed (node 8.1.1).
nodes.benefit: Identifies systemic issues, not just documentation gaps

nodes.name: BEST PRACTICE 4: Add Value Beyond Compliance
nodes.description: Make audits valuable: Not just finding nonconformities - identify improvement opportunities; Recognize good practices (use Positive Practice nodes); Share best practices across organization; Provide constructive suggestions, not just criticism; Help auditees understand 'why' behind requirements; Facilitate problem-solving discussions; Look for efficiency improvements; Consider business impact, not just compliance; Be a partner in improvement, not just a critic; Document observations that could prevent future issues.
nodes.benefit: Audits seen as helpful, not punitive
nodes.impact: Better cooperation and more effective improvements

nodes.name: TIP: Use Search to Find Anything Fast
nodes.description: The search function (top of interface) is powerful: Search by clause number (e.g., '8.1.3' finds Product Safety); Search by topic (e.g., 'calibration', 'FOD', 'configuration'); Search by category (e.g., 'checklist', 'finding'); Search by priority level; Search in descriptions for detailed topics; Use to quickly navigate large graphs; Search highlights matching nodes; Great for training - ask 'where is X requirement?'
nodes.howTo: Type in search box at top, matching nodes highlight in yellow
nodes.example: Search 'critical' to find all aerospace critical items and processes

nodes.name: TIP: Use Filter to Focus on Specific Areas
nodes.description: Filter feature helps manage complexity: Filter by Category (show only 'AS9100D Clause' or 'Audit Process'); Filter by Color (show only purple audit workflow nodes); Filter by Priority (show only Critical items); Hide irrelevant nodes temporarily; Great for presentations - show only relevant portions; Use during specific audits - show only Clause 8 nodes; Combine with search for powerful navigation; Reset filters to see full graph again.
nodes.howTo: Click btn-filter, select category/color/priority, click Apply
nodes.example: Filter by 'Audit Process' category to see only the workflow steps

nodes.name: TIP: Find Connections with Shortest Path
nodes.description: Shortest Path tool shows relationships: Click btn-shortest-path; Select start node (e.g., specific finding); Select end node (e.g., AS9100D clause); Tool shows all connection paths; Understand requirement traceability; Great for training - 'how does this relate to that?'; Show impact of findings; Trace from symptom to root cause; Demonstrate audit flow connections; Educational tool for understanding standard structure.
nodes.howTo: Click shortest path button, click start node, click end node
nodes.example: Path from 'Calibration overdue' finding to Clause 7.1.5 requirement

nodes.name: TIP: Save Multiple Versions
nodes.description: Version control your audit system: Save original as 'AS9100D_Template.json'; Save working version as 'AS9100D_2026.json'; Save after major updates; Keep backup before major changes; Save different versions for different sites/divisions; Export snapshots before audits; Save with date stamps; Use Save As to create new versions; Keep version history for trending; Compare versions to see what changed.
nodes.howTo: File ‚Üí Save As, give descriptive name with date

nodes.name: TROUBLESHOOTING Common Issues
nodes.description: Common issues and solutions: GRAPH TOO CLUTTERED ‚Üí Use filter or freeze simulation; CANT FIND NODE ‚Üí Use search function; NODES OVERLAPPING ‚Üí Click shuffle/layout button to rearrange; SLOW PERFORMANCE ‚Üí Freeze simulation or reduce force strength slider; LOST CHANGES ‚Üí Remember to save (Ctrl+S) frequently; EDGES HARD TO SEE ‚Üí Click on nodes to highlight connections; PROPERTIES NOT SHOWING ‚Üí Click directly on node; TOO MANY NODES MOVING ‚Üí Freeze individual nodes by double-clicking them.
nodes.contactSupport: Check help.html file for detailed documentation

nodes.name: ADVANCED: Integration with Other Systems
nodes.description: Enhance your audit system: Export to Excel for reporting (File ‚Üí Export); Link nodes to your document management system; Connect to quality management software; Use link fields to reference SharePoint/network locations; Embed URLs to internal portals; Link to customer portals and scorecards; Connect to CAPA tracking systems; Reference training management systems; Link to calibration databases; Create dashboards based on node data; Export metrics for management presentations.
nodes.benefit: Creates a central hub connecting all quality systems
nodes.consideration: Ensure links remain valid as systems change

nodes.name: ADVANCED: Extract Audit Metrics
nodes.description: Use the graph for metrics tracking: Count findings by clause (which clauses have most issues?); Track finding closure rates over time; Monitor repeat findings (search for similar descriptions); Analyze audit schedule adherence; Calculate audit hours vs. planned; Track corrective action effectiveness; Identify training needs (which areas have most findings?); Trend analysis - are things improving?; Benchmark against program metrics node; Generate reports for management review; Feed metrics back into risk assessment.
nodes.benefit: Data-driven decisions for audit program improvement
nodes.powerfulUse: Show trends to demonstrate QMS effectiveness

nodes.name: NEXT STEPS: Making This System Yours
nodes.description: To fully implement: 1) Complete all customization steps (add your documents, processes, personnel); 2) Conduct a pilot audit using the system; 3) Gather feedback from auditors; 4) Refine node descriptions and questions based on experience; 5) Train all auditors on using the system; 6) Integrate into your audit planning meetings; 7) Use for real-time finding tracking; 8) Review quarterly and update; 9) Present to management to demonstrate audit program sophistication; 10) Continuous improvement - keep enhancing the system based on lessons learned.
nodes.success: When auditors use the graph as their primary audit planning and tracking tool
